    • Method Detail

      • create

        JobCreateResponse create(JobCreateParameters parameters)
                  throws IOException,
                         ServiceException,
                         URISyntaxException
        Creates a new Job, allowing the service to generate a job id. Use CreateOrUpdate if a user-chosen job id is required.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Required. Parameters specifying the job definition for a Create Job operation.
        Returns:
        The Create Job operation response.
        Throws:
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
        URISyntaxException - Thrown if there was an error parsing a URI in the response.

      • createAsync

        Future<JobCreateResponse> createAsync(JobCreateParameters parameters)
        Creates a new Job, allowing the service to generate a job id. Use CreateOrUpdate if a user-chosen job id is required.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Required. Parameters specifying the job definition for a Create Job operation.
        Returns:
        The Create Job operation response.

      • createOrUpdate

        JobCreateOrUpdateResponse createOrUpdate(String jobId,
                                         JobCreateOrUpdateParameters parameters)
                                  throws IOException,
                                         ServiceException,
                                         URISyntaxException
        Creates a new Job with a user-provided job id, or updates an existing job, replacing its definition with that specified.
        Parameters:
        jobId - Required. Id of the job to create or update.
        parameters - Required. Parameters specifying the job definition for a CreateOrUpdate Job operation.
        Returns:
        The CreateOrUpdate Job operation response.
        Throws:
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
        URISyntaxException - Thrown if there was an error parsing a URI in the response.
